gloss: (physics) the rate of change of the angular position of a rotating body; usually expressed in radians per second or radians per minute / a center of activity or interest or commerce or transportation; a focal point around which events revolve / a measure of the potential energy of a unit charge at a given point in a circuit relative to a reference point (ground) / a unit of conductance equal to the reciprocal of an ohm / at every point / center upon
a straight line can be drawn between any two points
(physics) a point in the ideal multidimensional phase space that is used to describe a system toward which the system tends to evolve regardless of the starting conditions of the system
a center of activity or interest or commerce or transportation; a focal point around which events revolve

a center of activity or interest or commerce or transportation; a focal point around which events revolve / a point or principle on which scattered or opposing groups can come together / center upon / the yield from plants in a single growing season / the yield of fruit / yield crops

of or relating to the palm of the hand or to the area at the base of the thumb / of or relating to the region of the arm in front of the elbow / the part of the main artery of the arm that lies in the armpit and is continuous with the subclavian artery above and the brachial artery below

a harmonic with a frequency that is a multiple of the fundamental frequency / the lowest tone of a harmonic series / the syllable naming the fourth (subdominant) note of the diatonic scale in solmization
